title: ICT-Enabled Reflective Practice and Instructional Design Education for Preservice Language Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, emphasizing practical ICT tool utilization applicable to language education settings.

learning_goals: Prospective language teachers can enhance educational effectiveness by over 20% by applying reflective practice when designing ICT tool-based lessons
Learners can design ICT-integrated lessons focusing on reflective practice and instructional design among Tondeur et al. (2012)'s six teaching preparation strategies.
Participants can design three or more language learning activities using free digital tools accessible via smartphones (e.g., Kahoot!, Padlet).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
